43  /**
44   * HTableDescriptor contains the details about an HBase table  such as the descriptors of
45   * all the column families, is the table a catalog table, <code> -ROOT- </code> or 
46   * <code> .META. </code>, is the table is read only, the maximum size of the memstore, 
47   * when the region split should occur, coprocessors associated with it etc...
48   */
49  public class HTableDescriptor implements WritableComparable<HTableDescriptor> {
50

52     *  Changes prior to version 3 were not recorded here.
53     *  Version 3 adds metadata as a map where keys and values are byte[].
54     *  Version 4 adds indexes
55     *  Version 5 removed transactional pollution -- e.g. indexes
56     */
57    private static final byte TABLE_DESCRIPTOR_VERSION = 5;

174   /**
175    * <em> INTERNAL </em> Private constructor used internally creating table descriptors for
176    * catalog tables, <code>.META.</code> and <code>-ROOT-</code>.
177    */
178   protected HTableDescriptor(final byte [] name, HColumnDescriptor[] families) {
179     this.name = name.clone();
180     this.nameAsString = Bytes.toString(this.name);
181     setMetaFlags(name);
182     for(HColumnDescriptor descriptor : families) {
183       this.families.put(descriptor.getName(), descriptor);
184     }
185   }
186 
187   /**
188    * <em> INTERNAL </em>Private constructor used internally creating table descriptors for
189    * catalog tables, <code>.META.</code> and <code>-ROOT-</code>.
190    */
191   protected HTableDescriptor(final byte [] name, HColumnDescriptor[] families,
192       Map<ImmutableBytesWritable,ImmutableBytesWritable> values) {
193     this.name = name.clone();
194     this.nameAsString = Bytes.toString(this.name);
195     setMetaFlags(name);
196     for(HColumnDescriptor descriptor : families) {
197       this.families.put(descriptor.getName(), descriptor);
198     }
199     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> entry:
200         values.entrySet()) {
201       this.values.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
202     }
203   }

210   public HTableDescriptor() {
211     super();
212   }

214   /**
215    * Construct a table descriptor specifying table name.
216    * @param name Table name.
217    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if passed a table name
218    * that is made of other than 'word' characters, underscore or period: i.e.
219    * <code>[a-zA-Z_0-9.].
220    * @see <a href="HADOOP-1581">HADOOP-1581 HBASE: Un-openable tablename bug</a>
221    */
222   public HTableDescriptor(final String name) {
223     this(Bytes.toBytes(name));
224   }
225 
226   /**
227    * Construct a table descriptor specifying a byte array table name
228    * @param name - Table name as a byte array.
229    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if passed a table name
230    * that is made of other than 'word' characters, underscore or period: i.e.
231    * <code>[a-zA-Z_0-9-.].
232    * @see <a href="HADOOP-1581">HADOOP-1581 HBASE: Un-openable tablename bug</a>
233    */
234   public HTableDescriptor(final byte [] name) {
235     super();
236     setMetaFlags(this.name);
237     this.name = this.isMetaRegion()? name: isLegalTableName(name);
238     this.nameAsString = Bytes.toString(this.name);
239   }
240 
241   /**
242    * Construct a table descriptor by cloning the descriptor passed as a parameter.
243    * <p>
244    * Makes a deep copy of the supplied descriptor.
245    * Can make a modifiable descriptor from an UnmodifyableHTableDescriptor.
246    * @param desc The descriptor.
247    */
248   public HTableDescriptor(final HTableDescriptor desc) {
249     super();
250     this.name = desc.name.clone();
251     this.nameAsString = Bytes.toString(this.name);
252     setMetaFlags(this.name);
253     for (HColumnDescriptor c: desc.families.values()) {
254       this.families.put(c.getName(), new HColumnDescriptor(c));
255     }
256     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e:
257         desc.values.entrySet()) {
258       this.values.put(e.getKey(), e.getValue());
259     }
260   }
261 
262   /*
263    * Set meta flags on this table. 
264    * IS_ROOT_KEY is set if its a -ROOT- table
265    * IS_META_KEY is set either if its a -ROOT- or a .META. table 
266    * Called by constructors.
267    * @param name
268    */
269   private void setMetaFlags(final byte [] name) {
270     setRootRegion(Bytes.equals(name, HConstants.ROOT_TABLE_NAME));
271     setMetaRegion(isRootRegion() ||
272       Bytes.equals(name, HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME));
273   }
274 
275   /**
276    * Check if the descriptor represents a <code> -ROOT- </code> region.
277    * 
278    * @return true if this is a <code> -ROOT- </code> region 
279    */
280   public boolean isRootRegion() {
281     if (this.root == null) {
282       this.root = isSomething(IS_ROOT_KEY, false)? Boolean.TRUE: Boolean.FALSE;
283     }
284     return this.root.booleanValue();
285   }
286 
287   /**
288    * <em> INTERNAL </em> Used to denote if the current table represents 
289    * <code> -ROOT- </code> region. This is used internally by the 
290    * HTableDescriptor constructors 
291    * 
292    * @param isRoot true if this is the <code> -ROOT- </code> region 
293    */
294   protected void setRootRegion(boolean isRoot) {
295     // TODO: Make the value a boolean rather than String of boolean.
296     values.put(IS_ROOT_KEY, isRoot? TRUE: FALSE);
297   }
298 
299   /**
300    * Checks if this table is either <code> -ROOT- </code> or <code> .META. </code>
301    * region. 
302    *  
303    * @return true if this is either a <code> -ROOT- </code> or <code> .META. </code> 
304    * region 
305    */
306   public boolean isMetaRegion() {
307     if (this.meta == null) {
308       this.meta = calculateIsMetaRegion();
309     }
310     return this.meta.booleanValue();
311   }
312 
313   private synchronized Boolean calculateIsMetaRegion() {
314     byte [] value = getValue(IS_META_KEY);
315     return (value != null)? Boolean.valueOf(Bytes.toString(value)): Boolean.FALSE;
316   }
317 
318   private boolean isSomething(final ImmutableBytesWritable key,
319       final boolean valueIfNull) {
320     byte [] value = getValue(key);
321     if (value != null) {
322       // TODO: Make value be a boolean rather than String of boolean.
323       return Boolean.valueOf(Bytes.toString(value)).booleanValue();
324     }
325     return valueIfNull;
326   }
327 
328   /**
329    * <em> INTERNAL </em> Used to denote if the current table represents 
330    * <code> -ROOT- </code> or <code> .META. </code> region. This is used 
331    * internally by the HTableDescriptor constructors 
332    * 
333    * @param isMeta true if its either <code> -ROOT- </code> or 
334    * <code> .META. </code> region 
335    */
336   protected void setMetaRegion(boolean isMeta) {
337     values.put(IS_META_KEY, isMeta? TRUE: FALSE);
338   }
339 
340   /** 
341    * Checks if the table is a <code>.META.</code> table 
342    *  
343    * @return true if table is <code> .META. </code> region.
344    */
345   public boolean isMetaTable() {
346     return isMetaRegion() && !isRootRegion();
347   }
348  
349   /**
350    * Checks of the tableName being passed represents either 
351    * <code > -ROOT- </code> or <code> .META. </code>
352    *  
353    * @return true if a tablesName is either <code> -ROOT- </code> 
354    * or <code> .META. </code>
355    */
356   public static boolean isMetaTable(final byte [] tableName) {
357     return Bytes.equals(tableName, HConstants.ROOT_TABLE_NAME) ||
358       Bytes.equals(tableName, HConstants.META_TABLE_NAME);
359   }

361   // A non-capture group so that this can be embedded.
362   public static final String VALID_USER_TABLE_REGEX = "(?:[a-zA-Z_0-9][a-zA-Z_0-9.-]*)";
363 
364   /**
365    * Check passed byte buffer, "tableName", is legal user-space table name.
366    * @return Returns passed <code>tableName</code> param
367    * @throws NullPointerException If passed <code>tableName</code> is null
368    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if passed a tableName
369    * that is made of other than 'word' characters or underscores: i.e.
370    * <code>[a-zA-Z_0-9].
371    */
372   public static byte [] isLegalTableName(final byte [] tableName) {
373     if (tableName == null || tableName.length <= 0) {
374       throw new IllegalArgumentException("Name is null or empty");
375     }
376     if (tableName[0] == '.' || tableName[0] == '-') {
377       throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal first character <" + tableName[0] +
378           "> at 0. User-space table names can only start with 'word " +
379           "characters': i.e. [a-zA-Z_0-9]: " + Bytes.toString(tableName));
380     }
381     for (int i = 0; i < tableName.length; i++) {
382       if (Character.isLetterOrDigit(tableName[i]) || tableName[i] == '_' || 
383     		  tableName[i] == '-' || tableName[i] == '.') {
384         continue;
385       }
386       throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal character <" + tableName[i] +
387         "> at " + i + ". User-space table names can only contain " +
388         "'word characters': i.e. [a-zA-Z_0-9-.]: " + Bytes.toString(tableName));
389     }
390     return tableName;
391   }

400   public byte[] getValue(byte[] key) {
401     return getValue(new ImmutableBytesWritable(key));
402   }

404   private byte[] getValue(final ImmutableBytesWritable key) {
405     ImmutableBytesWritable ibw = values.get(key);
406     if (ibw == null)
407       return null;
408     return ibw.get();
409   }
410 
411   /**
412    * Getter for accessing the metadata associated with the key
413    *  
414    * @param key The key.
415    * @return The value.
416    * @see #values
417    */
418   public String getValue(String key) {
419     byte[] value = getValue(Bytes.toBytes(key));
420     if (value == null)
421       return null;
422     return Bytes.toString(value);
423   }

497   /**
498    * Check if the readOnly flag of the table is set. If the readOnly flag is 
499    * set then the contents of the table can only be read from but not modified.
500    * 
501    * @return true if all columns in the table should be read only
502    */
503   public boolean isReadOnly() {
504     return isSomething(READONLY_KEY, DEFAULT_READONLY);
505   }
506 
507   /**
508    * Setting the table as read only sets all the columns in the table as read
509    * only. By default all tables are modifiable, but if the readOnly flag is 
510    * set to true then the contents of the table can only be read but not modified.
511    *  
512    * @param readOnly True if all of the columns in the table should be read
513    * only.
514    */
515   public void setReadOnly(final boolean readOnly) {
516     setValue(READONLY_KEY, readOnly? TRUE: FALSE);
517   }
518 
519   /**
520    * Check if deferred log edits are enabled on the table.  
521    * 
522    * @return true if that deferred log flush is enabled on the table
523    * 
524    * @see #setDeferredLogFlush(boolean)
525    */
526   public synchronized boolean isDeferredLogFlush() {
527     if(this.isDeferredLog == null) {
528       this.isDeferredLog =
529           isSomething(DEFERRED_LOG_FLUSH_KEY, DEFAULT_DEFERRED_LOG_FLUSH);
530     }
531     return this.isDeferredLog;
532   }
533 
534   /**
535    * This is used to defer the log edits syncing to the file system. Everytime 
536    * an edit is sent to the server it is first sync'd to the file system by the 
537    * log writer. This sync is an expensive operation and thus can be deferred so 
538    * that the edits are kept in memory for a specified period of time as represented
539    * by <code> hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval </code> and not flushed
540    * for every edit.
541    * <p>
542    * NOTE:- This option might result in data loss if the region server crashes
543    * before these deferred edits in memory are flushed onto the filesystem. 
544    * </p>
545    * 
546    * @param isDeferredLogFlush
547    */
548   public void setDeferredLogFlush(final boolean isDeferredLogFlush) {
549     setValue(DEFERRED_LOG_FLUSH_KEY, isDeferredLogFlush? TRUE: FALSE);
550     this.isDeferredLog = isDeferredLogFlush;
551   }

571   /**
572    * This get the class associated with the region split policy which 
573    * determines when a region split should occur.  The class used by
574    * default is {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.ConstantSizeRegionSplitPolicy}
575    * which split the region base on a constant {@link #getMaxFileSize()}
576    * 
577    * @return the class name of the region split policy for this table.
578    * If this returns null, the default constant size based split policy
579    * is used.
580    */
581    public String getRegionSplitPolicyClassName() {
582     return getValue(SPLIT_POLICY);
583   }

588    * @param name name of table

590   public void setName(byte[] name) {
591     this.name = name;
592     this.nameAsString = Bytes.toString(this.name);
593     setMetaFlags(this.name);
594   }

596   /** 
597    * Returns the maximum size upto which a region can grow to after which a region
598    * split is triggered. The region size is represented by the size of the biggest
599    * store file in that region.
600    *
601    * @return max hregion size for table, -1 if not set.
602    *
603    * @see #setMaxFileSize(long)
604    */
605   public long getMaxFileSize() {
606     byte [] value = getValue(MAX_FILESIZE_KEY);
607     if (value != null) {
608       return Long.parseLong(Bytes.toString(value));
609     }
610     return -1;
611   }
612 
613   /**
614    * Sets the maximum size upto which a region can grow to after which a region
615    * split is triggered. The region size is represented by the size of the biggest 
616    * store file in that region, i.e. If the biggest store file grows beyond the 
617    * maxFileSize, then the region split is triggered. This defaults to a value of 
618    * 256 MB.
619    * <p>
620    * This is not an absolute value and might vary. Assume that a single row exceeds 
621    * the maxFileSize then the storeFileSize will be greater than maxFileSize since
622    * a single row cannot be split across multiple regions 
623    * </p>
624    * 
625    * @param maxFileSize The maximum file size that a store file can grow to
626    * before a split is triggered.
627    */
628   public void setMaxFileSize(long maxFileSize) {
629     setValue(MAX_FILESIZE_KEY, Bytes.toBytes(Long.toString(maxFileSize)));
630   }
631 
632   /**
633    * Returns the size of the memstore after which a flush to filesystem is triggered.
634    *
635    * @return memory cache flush size for each hregion, -1 if not set.
636    *
637    * @see #setMemStoreFlushSize(long)
638    */
639   public long getMemStoreFlushSize() {
640     byte [] value = getValue(MEMSTORE_FLUSHSIZE_KEY);
641     if (value != null) {
642       return Long.parseLong(Bytes.toString(value));
643     }
644     return -1;
645   }
646 
647   /**
648    * Represents the maximum size of the memstore after which the contents of the 
649    * memstore are flushed to the filesystem. This defaults to a size of 64 MB.
650    * 
651    * @param memstoreFlushSize memory cache flush size for each hregion
652    */
653   public void setMemStoreFlushSize(long memstoreFlushSize) {
654     setValue(MEMSTORE_FLUSHSIZE_KEY,
655       Bytes.toBytes(Long.toString(memstoreFlushSize)));
656   }

658   /**
659    * Adds a column family.
660    * @param family HColumnDescriptor of family to add.
661    */
662   public void addFamily(final HColumnDescriptor family) {
663     if (family.getName() == null || family.getName().length <= 0) {
664       throw new NullPointerException("Family name cannot be null or empty");
665     }
666     this.families.put(family.getName(), family);
667   }

678   /**
679    * @return Name of this table and then a map of all of the column family
680    * descriptors.
681    * @see #getNameAsString()
682    */
683   @Override
684   public String toString() {
685     StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
686     s.append('{');
687     s.append(HConstants.NAME);
688     s.append(" => '");
689     s.append(Bytes.toString(name));
690     s.append("'");
691     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e:
692         values.entrySet()) {
693       String key = Bytes.toString(e.getKey().get());
694       String value = Bytes.toString(e.getValue().get());
695       if (key == null) {
696         continue;
697       }
698       String upperCase = key.toUpperCase();
699       if (upperCase.equals(IS_ROOT) || upperCase.equals(IS_META)) {
700         // Skip. Don't bother printing out read-only values if false.
701         if (value.toLowerCase().equals(Boolean.FALSE.toString())) {
702           continue;
703         }
704       }
705       s.append(", ");
706       s.append(Bytes.toString(e.getKey().get()));
707       s.append(" => '");
708       s.append(Bytes.toString(e.getValue().get()));
709       s.append("'");
710     }
711     s.append(", ");
712     s.append(FAMILIES);
713     s.append(" => ");
714     s.append(families.values());
715     s.append('}');
716     return s.toString();
717   }

723   public String toStringCustomizedValues() {

733       String value = Bytes.toString(e.getValue().get());

736       }

738       if (upperCase.equals(IS_ROOT) || upperCase.equals(IS_META)) {
739         // Skip. Don't bother printing out read-only values if false.
740         if (value.toLowerCase().equals(Boolean.FALSE.toString())) {
741           continue;
742         }
743       }
744       s.append(", ");
745       s.append(Bytes.toString(e.getKey().get()));
746       s.append(" => '");

748       s.append("'");

765   /**
766    * Compare the contents of the descriptor with another one passed as a parameter. 
767    * Checks if the obj passed is an instance of HTableDescriptor, if yes then the
768    * contents of the descriptors are compared.
769    * 
770    * @return true if the contents of the the two descriptors exactly match
771    * 
772    * @see java.lang.Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
773    */
774   @Override
775   public boolean equals(Object obj) {
776     if (this == obj) {
777       return true;
778     }
779     if (obj == null) {
780       return false;
781     }
782     if (!(obj instanceof HTableDescriptor)) {
783       return false;
784     }
785     return compareTo((HTableDescriptor)obj) == 0;
786   }

788   /**
789    * @see java.lang.Object#hashCode()
790    */
791   @Override
792   public int hashCode() {
793     int result = Bytes.hashCode(this.name);
794     result ^= Byte.valueOf(TABLE_DESCRIPTOR_VERSION).hashCode();
795     if (this.families != null && this.families.size() > 0) {
796       for (HColumnDescriptor e: this.families.values()) {
797         result ^= e.hashCode();
798       }
799     }
800     result ^= values.hashCode();
801     return result;
802   }

804   // Writable
805   /**
806    * <em> INTERNAL </em> This method is a part of {@link WritableComparable} interface 
807    * and is used for de-serialization of the HTableDescriptor over RPC
808    */
809   @Override
810   public void readFields(DataInput in) throws IOException {
811     int version = in.readInt();
812     if (version < 3)
813       throw new IOException("versions < 3 are not supported (and never existed!?)");
814     // version 3+
815     name = Bytes.readByteArray(in);
816     nameAsString = Bytes.toString(this.name);
817     setRootRegion(in.readBoolean());
818     setMetaRegion(in.readBoolean());
819     values.clear();
820     int numVals = in.readInt();
821     for (int i = 0; i < numVals; i++) {
822       ImmutableBytesWritable key = new ImmutableBytesWritable();
823       ImmutableBytesWritable value = new ImmutableBytesWritable();
824       key.readFields(in);
825       value.readFields(in);
826       values.put(key, value);
827     }
828     families.clear();
829     int numFamilies = in.readInt();
830     for (int i = 0; i < numFamilies; i++) {
831       HColumnDescriptor c = new HColumnDescriptor();
832       c.readFields(in);
833       families.put(c.getName(), c);
834     }
835     if (version < 4) {
836       return;
837     }
838   }

840   /**
841    * <em> INTERNAL </em> This method is a part of {@link WritableComparable} interface 
842    * and is used for serialization of the HTableDescriptor over RPC
843    */
844   @Override
845   public void write(DataOutput out) throws IOException {
846 	out.writeInt(TABLE_DESCRIPTOR_VERSION);
847     Bytes.writeByteArray(out, name);
848     out.writeBoolean(isRootRegion());
849     out.writeBoolean(isMetaRegion());
850     out.writeInt(values.size());
851     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e:
852         values.entrySet()) {
853       e.getKey().write(out);
854       e.getValue().write(out);
855     }
856     out.writeInt(families.size());
857     for(Iterator<HColumnDescriptor> it = families.values().iterator();
858         it.hasNext(); ) {
859       HColumnDescriptor family = it.next();
860       family.write(out);
861     }
862   }

866   /**
867    * Compares the descriptor with another descriptor which is passed as a parameter.
868    * This compares the content of the two descriptors and not the reference.
869    * 
870    * @return 0 if the contents of the descriptors are exactly matching, 
871    * 		 1 if there is a mismatch in the contents 
872    */
873   @Override
874   public int compareTo(final HTableDescriptor other) {
875     int result = Bytes.compareTo(this.name, other.name);
876     if (result == 0) {
877       result = families.size() - other.families.size();
878     }
879     if (result == 0 && families.size() != other.families.size()) {
880       result = Integer.valueOf(families.size()).compareTo(
881           Integer.valueOf(other.families.size()));
882     }
883     if (result == 0) {
884       for (Iterator<HColumnDescriptor> it = families.values().iterator(),
885           it2 = other.families.values().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
886         result = it.next().compareTo(it2.next());
887         if (result != 0) {
888           break;
889         }
890       }
891     }
892     if (result == 0) {
893       // punt on comparison for ordering, just calculate difference
894       result = this.values.hashCode() - other.values.hashCode();
895       if (result < 0)
896         result = -1;
897       else if (result > 0)
898         result = 1;
899     }
900     return result;
901   }

980   /**
981    * Add a table coprocessor to this table. The coprocessor
982    * type must be {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.RegionObserver}
983    * or Endpoint.
984    * It won't check if the class can be loaded or not.
985    * Whether a coprocessor is loadable or not will be determined when
986    * a region is opened.
987    * @param jarFilePath Path of the jar file. If it's null, the class will be
988    * loaded from default classloader.
989    * @param className Full class name.
990    * @param priority Priority
991    * @param kvs Arbitrary key-value parameter pairs passed into the coprocessor.
992    * @throws IOException
993    */
994   public void addCoprocessor(String className, Path jarFilePath,
995                              int priority, final Map<String, String> kvs)
996   throws IOException {
997     if (hasCoprocessor(className)) {
998       throw new IOException("Coprocessor " + className + " already exists.");
999     }
1000     // validate parameter kvs
1001     StringBuilder kvString = new StringBuilder();
1002     if (kvs != null) {
1003       for (Map.Entry<String, String> e: kvs.entrySet()) {
1004         if (!e.getKey().matches(HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_VALUE_PARAM_KEY_PATTERN)) {
1005           throw new IOException("Illegal parameter key = " + e.getKey());
1006         }
1007         if (!e.getValue().matches(HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_VALUE_PARAM_VALUE_PATTERN)) {
1008           throw new IOException("Illegal parameter (" + e.getKey() +
1009               ") value = " + e.getValue());
1010         }
1011         if (kvString.length() != 0) {
1012           kvString.append(',');
1013         }
1014         kvString.append(e.getKey());
1015         kvString.append('=');
1016         kvString.append(e.getValue());
1017       }
1018     }
1019 
1020     // generate a coprocessor key
1021     int maxCoprocessorNumber = 0;
1022     Matcher keyMatcher;
1023     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e:
1024         this.values.entrySet()) {
1025       keyMatcher =
1026           HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_KEY_PATTERN.matcher(
1027               Bytes.toString(e.getKey().get()));
1028       if (!keyMatcher.matches()) {
1029         continue;
1030       }
1031       maxCoprocessorNumber = Math.max(Integer.parseInt(keyMatcher.group(1)),
1032           maxCoprocessorNumber);
1033     }
1034     maxCoprocessorNumber++;
1035 
1036     String key = "coprocessor$" + Integer.toString(maxCoprocessorNumber);
1037     String value = ((jarFilePath == null)? "" : jarFilePath.toString()) +
1038         "|" + className + "|" + Integer.toString(priority) + "|" +
1039         kvString.toString();
1040     setValue(key, value);
1041   }

1044   /**
1045    * Check if the table has an attached co-processor represented by the name className
1046    *
1047    * @param className - Class name of the co-processor
1048    * @return true of the table has a co-processor className
1049    */
1050   public boolean hasCoprocessor(String className) {
1051     Matcher keyMatcher;
1052     Matcher valueMatcher;
1053     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e:
1054         this.values.entrySet()) {
1055       keyMatcher =
1056           HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_KEY_PATTERN.matcher(
1057               Bytes.toString(e.getKey().get()));
1058       if (!keyMatcher.matches()) {
1059         continue;
1060       }
1061       valueMatcher =
1062         HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_VALUE_PATTERN.matcher(
1063             Bytes.toString(e.getValue().get()));
1064       if (!valueMatcher.matches()) {
1065         continue;
1066       }
1067       // get className and compare
1068       String clazz = valueMatcher.group(2).trim(); // classname is the 2nd field
1069       if (clazz.equals(className.trim())) {
1070         return true;
1071       }
1072     }
1073     return false;
1074   }

1079    * @return The list of co-processors classNames

1081   public List<String> getCoprocessors() {
1082     List<String> result = new ArrayList<String>();
1083     Matcher keyMatcher;
1084     Matcher valueMatcher;
1085     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e : this.values.entrySet()) {
1086       keyMatcher = HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_KEY_PATTERN.matcher(Bytes.toString(e.getKey().get()));
1087       if (!keyMatcher.matches()) {
1088         continue;
1089       }
1090       valueMatcher = HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_VALUE_PATTERN.matcher(Bytes
1091           .toString(e.getValue().get()));
1092       if (!valueMatcher.matches()) {
1093         continue;
1094       }
1095       result.add(valueMatcher.group(2).trim()); // classname is the 2nd field
1096     }
1097     return result;

1100   /**
1101    * Remove a coprocessor from those set on the table
1102    * @param className Class name of the co-processor
1103    */
1104   public void removeCoprocessor(String className) {
1105     ImmutableBytesWritable match = null;
1106     Matcher keyMatcher;
1107     Matcher valueMatcher;
1108     for (Map.Entry<ImmutableBytesWritable, ImmutableBytesWritable> e : this.values
1109         .entrySet()) {
1110       keyMatcher = HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_KEY_PATTERN.matcher(Bytes.toString(e
1111           .getKey().get()));
1112       if (!keyMatcher.matches()) {
1113         continue;
1114       }
1115       valueMatcher = HConstants.CP_HTD_ATTR_VALUE_PATTERN.matcher(Bytes
1116           .toString(e.getValue().get()));
1117       if (!valueMatcher.matches()) {
1118         continue;
1119       }
1120       // get className and compare
1121       String clazz = valueMatcher.group(2).trim(); // classname is the 2nd field
1122       // remove the CP if it is present
1123       if (clazz.equals(className.trim())) {
1124         match = e.getKey();
1125         break;
1126       }
1127     }
1128     // if we found a match, remove it
1129     if (match != null)
1130       this.values.remove(match);
1131   }
